intro: Hieracium acrotephraeum, commonly known as the alpine hawkweed, is a perennial herb native to the alpine regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or mountainous habitats, where it thrives in cool, moist environments. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow with a central disk. Hieracium acrotephraeum is often found in alpine meadows and is adapted to withstand harsh climatic conditions.
